moves.1. f4: Bird's opening. I don't have much experience in this opening.
moves.1... e5: I thought that this was logical.
moves.2. fxe5 Nc6: d6 is the book move, but I wanted to get a minor out and start developing.
moves.3... f6: I considered many variations if he didn't take.
moves.4... Nxf6: In retrospect, I should have taken with the pawn.
moves.5. e3 d5: I saw the pin on the Knight, but it didn't worry me.
moves.11. Nb3 Qf6 12. Nbd2: Hmmm... I suppose he did that since I could chop on e3 with the Queen.
moves.12... Bd6: Preparing for a nice little sac.
moves.13. Qc2: Now that the pin is gone, as is a defender, I attack.
moves.13... Bxf3 14. Nxf3 Rhf8: I should have taken with my Knight instead.
moves.18. Kxh2 Qh4+ 19. Kg1 Qe1+ 20. Kh2 Qh4+: He offers a draw, and I accept, since I don't have enough for another attack. Thank  you for reading! Please rate and comment! Thank you once again, alfil, for this great game!

gameName: A mating assault ends in Perpetual
